thread.title: Three charged in drug-dealing bust at Dumont home - News
thread.title_full: Three charged in drug-dealing bust at Dumont home - News - NorthJersey.com

author: CHRIS HARRIS
title: Three charged in drug-dealing bust at Dumont home - News
text:
Buy this photo BErgen County Prosecutor's Office From left, Angel Nicasio, Ernest Daney and Mariana Tuero Two men and one woman face marijuana-related charges after authorities disrupted an alleged Dumont-based drug-dealing operation.
Bergen County Prosecutor John L. Molinelli said detectives from his office's narcotics task force partnered with police in Dumont and Cresskill as well as officers from the Bergen County Sheriff's Office's K-9 Unit and the Bergen County Regional SWAT Team to raid a Stratford Avenue home on July 1. The residence had been under surveillance sparked by a tip to police.
Once inside the home, officers found marijuana packaged for sale, Molinelli said. Allegedly, there also were tabs of LSD inside the house along with codeine and promethazine syrup, digital scales, drug baggies and a heat sealer.
Molinelli said officers detained the home's residents — 19-year-old Angel Nicasio and Mariana Tuero, 38 — and a New York City man, Ernest Daney, who is 32.
Authorities said marijuana also was seized from Tuero's bedroom and Daney’s vehicle, which was parked outside the residence.
Nicasio was charged with a single count of possession with the intent to distribute marijuana and possession with the intent to distribute LSD, with additional charges possible, Molinelli said. He was released from the Bergen County Jail after posting $75,000 bail.
Tuero and Daney were charged with possession of less than 50 grams of marijuana under 50 grams and were released on their own recognizance.
Email: harrisc@northjersey.com
